results.title: Pretty woman (Director's cut)
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Steven Reuther, Arnon Milchan, Silver Screen Partners IV and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Garry Marshall “Pretty woman” was the film that helped make a star of American actress Julia Roberts. Originally conceived as a film with a much darker tone, “Pretty woman” is a fairly light-hearted comedy. Edward Lewis, (Richard Gere) a businessman whose speciality is company takeovers, is on assignment in LA when he picks up a prostitute, Viv (Roberts), for the night. In the morning Lewis decides he likes what he sees and decides to hire Viv for a week’s round of polo parties and sex. Despite being somewhat gauche in her dress and manner, Viv is groomed for the part of the society lady, in a Pygmalion like transformation. Challenges ensue for the couple as they take a liking to one another beyond the bounds of their business arrangement. Each is drawn to the possibility that at the week’s end their partnership may blossom into a relationship. Also stars Laura San Giacomo as Viv’s housemate (also a prostitute) and Jason Alexander who plays Lewis’ sleazy lawyer. This special edition version of “Pretty woman” is the director’s cut.

results.title: Pretty Penny
results.creator_credit: Shane Luther, Jacinta Stone and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A light-hearted cautionary tale about human ambitions and moral dilemmas that centres on the relationship between an avaricious coin collector and and a woman who owns a rare coin. Cast: Kestie Morrassi, Shane Luther. (Awards: Sydney Film Festival, 1999; Watch My Shorts Film Festival Melbourne, 1999; Sydney Video & Film Festival, 1999)

results.title: Power and terror: Noam Chomsky in our times
results.brief_description: A series of lectures by eminent American expert on foreign policy, Noam Chomsky, are centred around the issues of September 11 - the United States’ response to the disaster, as well as the Government’s participation in terrorism. Chomsky displays his signature articulation and intelligence in these illuminating pieces, providing a complex picture of world politics. He deftly places the terrorist attacks in the context of American foreign intervention throughout the decades: for example in Vietnam, Central America and the Middle East. In stark and uncompromising terms Chomsky presents his views that challenge widely held perceptions about America’s motivations, in a refreshingly composed and astute way. Some lectures include question and answer forums with the audience.

results.title: Pretty as a picture: the art of David Lynch
results.creator_credit: Toby Keeler and Fine Cut Presentations
results.brief_description: Using a behind the scenes look at the production of David Lynch’s ‘Lost highway’, this documentary looks at the auteur who brought us ‘Eraserhead’ (307091), ‘Elephant man’ (302534), ‘Blue velvet (302912), and the television series ‘Twin peaks’. He discusses his inspiration, impressions of his first film, and his drive for creative expression. Interviews are presented with actors who have starred in Lynchs’ films, relatives, and production crew. They include; Bill Pullman, Patricia Arquette, Mel Brooks, Jack Frisk, Barry Gifford, Jennifer Lynch, Jack Nance, Mary Sweeney and Dean Stockwell.

results.title: Preparing your child for school
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Glen Iver, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The start of a child’s schooling should set a positive tone for the rest of school life. This program looks at some common issues relevant to children about to start school and aims to put both the new pupil and the parent at ease.
